newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Cenbank sells 9.53 bln reais in bonds.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Cenbank sells 9.53 bln reais in bonds.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank sold 9.53 billion reais in 56-day and 182-day Central Bank Bonds (BBCs) at its weekly formal bond auction Tuesday, dealers said.
The Central Bank sold 6.798 billion reais in 56-day bonds at an overnight rate of 2.318 percent a month, up from 2.310 percent last week.
The 182-day bonds were sold at 2.219 percent a month, up from 2.215 percent, totalling 2.731 billion reais.
The financial result of the auction indicated 5.03 billion reais will be drained from the banking system as 4.5 billion reais in 56-day old bonds are coming due Wednesday.

Dealers said the Central Bank's decision to drain five billion reais from the market might be related to an increase in liquidity resulting from some 5.7 billion reais in credit lines made available by the Central Bank for the takeover of Banco Bamerindus do Brasil SA by HSBC Holdings Plc.
